quiz.title: Pre-calculus: Unit 3 Quiz 9
quiz.subtitle: 3.9: Writing Polynomials from Zeros
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Constructing equations from roots and points

questions.question: A polynomial has zeros at $x = 2$ and $x = -5$. What are its linear factors?
questions.explanation: Factors are always in the form $(x - r)$, so $x - (2)$ and $x - (-5)$.

questions.question: If a polynomial of degree 3 has zeros at $x = 0$ and $x = 4i$, what is the third zero?
questions.explanation: Complex zeros must occur in conjugate pairs when coefficients are real.

questions.question: Write a polynomial of minimum degree with zeros at $1$ (multiplicity 2) and $-3$.
questions.explanation: Multiplicity 2 means the factor $(x - 1)$ is squared.

questions.question: Find a polynomial with zeros at $x = 3i$ and $x = -3i$.
A polynomial $f(x) = a(x - 1)(x + 2)$ passes through $(0, 4)$. Find $a$.
What is the expanded form of a polynomial with zeros $0, 1, -1$?
If $x = 1 + \sqrt{2}$ is a zero, what other zero must exist for a polynomial with rational coefficients?
questions.explanation: Irrational roots involving square roots also come in conjugate pairs.

questions.question: A polynomial has degree 4. Zeros are $i$ and $2$ (multiplicity 2). What are all the factors?
questions.explanation: Zeros are $i, -i, 2, 2$. Factors are $(x - i), (x + i), (x - 2), (x - 2)$.

questions.question: Which polynomial has a zero at $x = 5$ with multiplicity 3?
True or False: A polynomial of degree $n$ is uniquely determined by its $n$ zeros alone.
questions.explanation: False, because you could have any vertical stretch factor $a$ and still have the same zeros.

scoreMessages.90: Brilliant! You can build complex functions from scratch.
scoreMessages.70: Good work. Don't forget those invisible conjugate pairs!
scoreMessages.50: Remember: if $r$ is the root, $(x - r)$ is the factor. Watch your signs.
scoreMessages.0: Review how to convert zeros into factors and how to find 'a'.
